4.01
Program Information Disclosure, Confidentiality and Use Restriction. FCE will promptly disclose to ExxonMobil, in
written or other tangible form, any and all Program Information including any Program Inventions. Except as otherwise
permitted under this Agreement, FCE agrees to hold Program Information in confidence, and not to disclose or make it
available to any third party without the express prior written consent of ExxonMobil, for a period commencing on the
Effective Date and ending twenty (20) years thereafter. Without the express prior written consent of ExxonMobil, FCE
agrees to use and practice Program Information only for the Program or as authorized in Article 7 (License to Program
Results).
perturbation.changed_text:
4.01
Project Data Disclosure, Confidentiality and Use Restriction. FCE will promptly disclose to ExxonMobil, in
written or other tangible form, any and all Program Information including any Program Inventions. Except as otherwise
permitted under this Agreement, FCE agrees to hold Technical Data in confidence, and not to disclose or make it
available to any third party without the express prior written consent of ExxonMobil, for a period commencing on the
Effective Date and ending twenty (20) years thereafter. Without the express prior written consent of ExxonMobil, FCE
agrees to use and practice Project Data only for the Program or as authorized in Article 7 (License to Program
Results).
perturbation.explanation: The terms "Program Information", "Technical Data", and "Project Data" are used interchangeably, but there is no clear definition of Project Data or Technical Data as separate from Program Information. This creates confusion regarding the scope of FCE's confidentiality obligations and permitted uses.

perturbation.original_text:
10.01
Project Costs.
a)
ExxonMobil will reimburse FCE for Research Costs (i.e., cumulative FTE Costs and Direct Costs) for each
Project subject to total caps set forth herein and in the relevant Project Description. Research Costs of FCE paid
for by ExxonMobil will be limited to FTE Costs for time actually spent on the Program and Direct Costs actually
incurred and approved in advance by the Steering Committee. The cumulative Research Costs for the Program
will not exceed forty-five million United States dollars ($45,000,000 USD) over the Term of the Agreement
(“Total Research Cost”). ExxonMobil will reimburse FCE for Research Costs after receipt of invoices on a
monthly basis. Invoices for Direct Costs will be supported by relevant third party invoices received by FCE
documenting such costs. Materials shall be invoiced as incurred and subject to a thirty percent (30%) service fee.
All such payments will be made after ExxonMobil’s receipt of invoices in accordance with the invoicing
procedures specified in Paragraphs 10.01(b)-(e) and in Paragraph 10.04 (Invoices).
perturbation.changed_text:
10.01
Project Expenses.
a)
ExxonMobil will reimburse FCE for Development Costs (i.e., cumulative FTE Costs and Direct Costs) for each
Undertaking subject to total caps set forth herein and in the relevant Project Description. Investigation Costs of FCE paid
for by ExxonMobil will be limited to FTE Costs for time actually spent on the Program and Direct Costs actually
incurred and approved in advance by the Steering Committee. The cumulative Research Costs for the Program
will not exceed forty-five million United States dollars ($45,000,000 USD) over the Term of the Agreement
(“Total Research Cost”). ExxonMobil will reimburse FCE for Development Costs after receipt of invoices on a
monthly basis. Invoices for Direct Costs will be supported by relevant third party invoices received by FCE
documenting such costs. Materials shall be invoiced as incurred and subject to a thirty percent (30%) service fee.
All such payments will be made after ExxonMobil’s receipt of invoices in accordance with the invoicing
procedures specified in Paragraphs 10.01(b)-(e) and in Paragraph 10.04 (Invoices).
perturbation.explanation: The terms "Research Costs", "Development Costs", "Project", and "Undertaking" are used without clear distinction. The paragraph opens referring to Project Costs then substitutes it with Development Costs, with the sentence later referring to Investigation Costs. The paragraph mentions the total cumulative cost to be no more than the 'Total Research Cost'. It is unclear whether Development Costs fall under Research Costs, or if 'Undertaking' is defined as 'Project'. This makes it difficult to understand how much ExxonMobil is obligated to reimburse, potentially leading to disputes.

11.01
Mutual Representations and Warranties. Each Party hereby represents and warrants to the other, to the best of its
knowledge, that:
(a)
as of the Effective Date:
1.
the execution, delivery and performance of this Agreement by such Party does not conflict with any
agreement, instrument or undertaking, oral or written, to which it is a party or by which it may be bound, and
2.
all necessary consents, approvals and authorizations of all governmental authorities and third parties required
to be obtained by such Party in connection with the execution, delivery, and performance of this Agreement
have been or will be obtained;
perturbation.changed_text:
11.01
Joint Declarations and Guarantees. Each Organization hereby declares and guarantees to the other, to the best of its
knowledge, that:
(a)
as of the Inception Date:
1.
the formulation, transmittal and fruition of this Accord by such Body does not oppose any
understanding, mechanism or commitment, oral or written, to which it is a member or by which it may be restrained, and
2.
all crucial acceptances, sanctions and authorisations of all administrative agencies and external entities demanded
to be secured by such Body regarding the formulation, transmittal, and fruition of this Accord
have been or will be procured;
perturbation.explanation: The terms have been switched out with other synonyms; these changes introduce internal contradiction by using unnecessarily formal terminology ("formulation," "transmittal," "fruition") which obscure meaning, making it more difficult to interpret the declarations and guarantees. Changing "Party" to "Organization" and "Agreement" to "Accord" without properly defining these terms creates confusion and makes it unclear who is subject to the warranty and what the warranty covers.
